author: .fjl
content: For this week's ACD, I have created an overview document to explain where we stand w.r.t. the RPC standardization process: https://notes.ethereum.org/@fjl/rpc-standards-2025-01

author: .fjl
content: Let me know what you think about it

author: .fjl
content: I would also like to discuss our options on ACD, at least the part about managing spec updates. There doesn't seem to be a good way of proposing updates right now,  it really only works for changes mandated by forks.

author: inspector.butters
content:
Great initiative. thanks for shining a light on this. 
I'm curious what "trustless-only API" means in practice?

author: .fjl
content:
it means:

- block information only accessible via block hash
- receipt access contains receipt tree proof
- state (balance/nonce) available only via proof
- eth_call like functionality includes execution witness as proof
- estimateGas contains execution witness as proof

author: .fjl
content: some things are very hard to do this way

author: .fjl
content: our idea is to have a somewhat minimal API in the beginning, and then expand it to cover more cases

author: .fjl
content: I see it as a way out of the problem that the RPC API has so many different implementations in different contexts

author: .fjl
content: but it's also important to realize the ecosystem will likely not move away from the JSON-RPC anytime soon, since it is so pervasive

author: inspector.butters
content:
another proposal to reach trustlessness (on both CL & EL) is this one: https://hackmd.io/@etan-status/electra-lc#SSZ-query-language
although it requires extending SSZ to EL transactions/receipts/withdrawals/etc (EIP-6404/6466/6465/7807)

what do you think about it as compared to Geth's idea?

author: .fjl
content: it sounds a bit like GraphQL-for-SSZ to me

author: .fjl
content: thing is, we have GraphQL already, but it's not used much

author: .fjl
content: Etan's proposal is orthogonal to the API we are thinking about in Geth

author: .fjl
content: We just want to clearly define the interface to the execution layer, in a trustless way
